The George Hotel is definitely top of my favourite hotels in Lagos, the hotel feels very secure and the rooms are spacious. Review Text: At nearly $400 for an executive suite, you are entitled to expect a lot.  The hotel and the rooms are beautiful, and the bedding is first class.  However, on their website they advertise "Complimentary Mini Bar, Nespresso Coffee and Tea".  Yes, there is a fridge - but empty.  Yes, there is a Nespresso machine - but no pods. Arriving at 1am, I was dying for a cold bottle of sparkling water.  Room service could not understand my english, so I had to go down to bar to buy an overpriced one. Also, when checking in, they kept my passport.  Upon enquiring over the phone, I was told to come downstairs to get it...really the last thing one wants to do at 1:30am. It could be a wonderful hotel, but they need to fix the details...

Beautiful and relaxing hotel in a great location. High quality interior, complete with beautiful art collection. Pool, gym, bar and restaurant all great. Prince at the bar is top notch! I will make this my regular spot on trips to Lagos.

Review Title: At the top of the list for Lagos Hotels
Review Text: Finding a quality hotel in Lagos is quite challenging - usually there's something wrong, either the water, or the climate control or... something...  The George is one of the few that get it right. I had a one week stay in the hotel - which can typically be revealing of warts. But this is a hotel that I left with the same positive attitude when I first checked in.   Lets get the bad out of the way: - The low cost rooms are pretty small. (they get MUCH better as you move up) - The food in the restaurant is pretty pricey. Some of it is worth it (try the prawns and avocado salad) but some of it is pedestrian (the hummous tastes like it came from a can) - There's not a lot of lobby seating - meetings are in the bar or outside weather permitting. Weather didn't permit during my stay.

I attended an Annual General Meeting in one of their conference rooms. I was impressed with the roomy nature of the hotel. Its parking lot was equally wide. Security was top notch. The buffet session was orderly, and the meal quite tasty.

Love the rooms. Very cozy and nice. the food is good. the staff are friendly and nice. Great hotel for a weekend getaway and its in a quiet part of ikoyi. Hotel is quite pricey but the service, food and overall experience is worth it

Find Christine, she's the best customer service person I've ever met. Their general reception is fantastic, they always find solutions and a so willing to help!   They're calm, efficient and super professional.

I organized a corporate event at the George √Æn mid-December and was very pleased with the outcome. The food was very nice. Staff was very friendly and the F&B manager did a fantastic job catering our every need.  The venue is truly fantastic and I would say the best hotel Lagos has to offer. Beautiful pool and honeslty the cleanest hotel. A great experience overall! If I organize another event the George would be my go-to place.

Spend a night at The George, after a stressful delated flight, what a nice surprise, cosy hotel, very specious rooms, a warm welcome at reception with a big smile, Rooms a tasteful decorated, The hotel is located in a very quiet area. Service is good, and public areas allows to relax after a long day, Pool and Gym areas are very well kept. The Room service was excellent an quick. Sunday brunch tasty and a lot a variety in food, I recommend do book a table, the George seems to be the In-Place in Town. Will certainly come back.

If you have been to the George Hotel, you would love to return again.  The  Award winning luxury is tucked inside Lugard Avenue, Ikoyi  and comes highly recommended for  luxurious, serene and private meetings. As you drive in through the gate, you are ushered in  by the sparingly lined palms and other greenery to the lobby.   No doubt it is designed strictly for high end business meetings and leisure activities and boasts of quality functional meeting rooms for functions (board retreats, workshops, fine dining whether local, continental or oriental  (led by an international chef)  and well trained personnel to ensure a worthwhile experience.  It is just off Thompson Avenue, Ikoyi and popular landmarks are the National Industrial Court of Nigeria, British Council and Day Waterman

Probably one of the best hotels I've been to in Nigeria. Stayed here for a weekend and the service was great, rooms were very spacious, interior design was up to standers very different from your usual hotels in Nigeria. The only issue is I felt like the food wasn't that great considering their prices. I would recommend this hotel if you are very particular on where you stay and it's located in ikoyi very peaceful area

Review Title: An awesome experience, great people good food
Review Text: The George is a well run, awesome sanctuary that is quite and well staffed, with good food. Rooms are great and supported by comfortable facilities. A real treat in a busy and demanding city with close proximity to the business district and reliable wifi

In the heart of the business district. Excellent quality room (although quite small for this price range). High quality breakfast. Friendly staff excellent gym. Really good food.  Definitely recommend.

The George is not just a hotel but a home away from home. It has a serene and peaceful ambiance and the staff always with smiley faces are warm and welcoming. Excellent reception desk and room service. It exceeded my expectations. I really need to thank all the Hotel Staff for the excellent service.  Such a wonderful place to stay .. It was more than awesome.

I first met Gordon while he managed the Avari Hotel in Karachi. I later discovered he had a new task of getting The George Hotel up to standard. I must be clear that while some follow a Hotel or chain I base my "home away from home" on service excellence which Gordon delivers on. This is the best hotel in Lagos, period. From service to food and rooms this establishment is impressive. Well done to a great team under Gordon's leadership.

I loved this hotel,its truly cozy ,with excellent staff and my oh my!! they have fantastic food.The rooms are well thought out and I got everything I  needed-from a nail file to a vanity kit,to a shoe cleaner not  forgetting the impeccable decor .And they knocked at my door and gave me chocolate-I literally melted.Highly recommended when you are in Lagos.

Had a late business lunch with a colleague at the George last week, it was around 4pm and had the dining room almost to ourselves. The service was good and attentive, would like to see what the service would be like at a busier time. I had seafood pasta while my colleague had what was called the New Zealand Lamb. They where both well prepared, what I found interesting was that my colleague said the lamb portion was more than he hoped for...... mostly places I eat lamb racks/chops it usually is a portion too small. Great atmosphere.... pricey but worth it.

Review Title: Our Monthly Lagos Dining Club Black Tie Dinner at the Antonello Suite, The George
Review Text: On behalf of the LDC we want to thank you most sincerely for the wonderful dinner held at your beautifully decorated Antonello Suite, last week.  Well done to your excellent Chef and his Kitchen Staff who produced a 5-course, 5-star meal of superb quality.  This was ably matched so well by the presentation and layout in the specially prepared dining room and the attention to detail to service under the ever attentive eye of Stephane.   The overall success of the event was a triumph for The George under the professional and very personal stewardship of GM, Gordon who stopped at nothing to ensure we had the best.  Surely the best dining experience in Lagos ever!  Congratulations and well done to all at The George.

We stayed in the George hotel for a business trip to Nigeria. The rooms are great, the food is fantastic and all that is finished with an excellent service. 100% recommended for business trips to Lagos and soroundings.

I had the opportunity to have a business meeting in the George hotel last week, I was unsure what to expect in terms of service,privacy and general surroundings. I was very impressed with the overall experience, the staff were courteous, prompt and most importantly discreet. Whilst we only had drinks on the pool terrace, I was very impressed with the whole feel of the place. I will be booking my next dinner meeting here , so I can try the food !!!

This has to be one of the best places I've been. Very quiet and clean to every detail!! The food is amazing,the drinks OMG!!  the staffs are excellent. The George is worth every penny. I will definitely recommend this place to anyone.

The George Hotel was the perfect venue for a surprise bday dinner held for my husband. Staff were super friendly, in particular the restaurant manager who exceeded both mine and my guest's expectations. The food was brilliant and atmosphere was spot on. I could not have asked for better service than i received. Kudos to The George Hotel Restaurant team.

The conference facilities, rooms, service, food and the overall management of the hotel is excellent, this is extraordinary as it is difficult to find this level of service anywhere in Nigeria. The attention to cleanliness is exceptional it seems that the manager is there 24/7 which ensures that there is no lapse in service which is usually the case.

I recently spent a week staying at The George, along with 10+ Executive colleagues - beautifully furnished rooms with comfort and luxury at the centre of it all. Great conference facilities, wonderful staff and personal care and attention by the GM, Gordon. Highly recommended.

Quality, service and facilities absolute world class. Friendly, efficient and above all a step ahead most times. Quality of food was consistently superb, no power interruption (had two days of meetings on site and thus power becomes an important consideration) due to generator, despite a couple of general outages in Lagos at the time.Big thumbs up to Gordon and his team.

I had a remarkably pleasant stay at The George during a recent business trip to Lagos. The room was furnished comfortably and tastefully, the food from room service and at the Sunday brunch extremely good and the service both discreet and efficient. I'll definitely stay there again during my next trip -and I say that having stayed at most of the city's other luxury hotels.

The George hotel is good and neat but the rack rate is very high, you will do well if you go on a survey of some of the good hotels in Ikoyi and Victoria Island and adjust your room rates accordingly. Thank you.

Review Title: Sanctuary in the bustle of Lagos
Review Text: It is my first time here and the feeling after a long flight and the bustle of Lagos airport, was comforting ie the reception. A few rough edges from the front desk staff would make the warm welcome even more calming. The hotel handbook says you can ask them. Few things whichbthey were not clear about. To their credit, I insisted and they made good.   Landing for a work trip on a Sunday just gets you to want to connect with family so super essential in today's world is the wifi - As fast as I have ever had in Nigeri so another point for them! Also, doesn't come with the irritating limit to a few gadgets...   Had a great shower and then Sunday brunch was quite a spread with a variety of well prepared food - both local and international cuisine. Nothing disappointed. And the best

Review Title: A great  night at the George!
Review Text: I experienced wonderful service from the front desk staff, they always make me want to come back!  I have stayed in various rooms and have loved them all. An overall great stay. I definitely will be going back.

Read some reviews and hard to believe that we are talking about the same hotel. The staff has been incredibly polite and welcoming. Almost everyone asks about your day, with smiles. When i had issues with a laptop, they readily put me through. I will definitely make this place, a home away from home J from Massachusetts

Excellent stay and highly recommended.  You get what you pay for and this must be single handedly the best hotel in Lagos. Manager goes out of his way to make you feel welcome and what a great host !  Good for business meetings and staff very friendly and helpful as well.   If you need treatment and food as well as wine from the top drawer, this is where you ill find it.

We have stayed in a few hotels in Lagos and I must say the George lived up to expectations as being the best - the facilities were excellent and the service was friendly and professional. We were celebrating a special event and they went out of their way to make everything special, it was really quite impressive.  Breakfast was excellent - nowhere else have I seen perfectly executed Eggs Florentine as part of a Nigerian hotel breakfast selection, and even the coffee was quite special. It is this attention to even the smallest of details that meant that the service was truly world class and we will be returning every chance we get!

Review Title: The George at Ikoyi is "Our Home"  away from home
Review Text: Customer service is great and the staff is very friendly and efficient. The rooms and the public areas are modern and spotless and their security is tight.The French executive Chef and Michael, the sous- chef have excellent dishes to suit every palate. I would certainly recommend their awesome breakfast and Sunday brunch.    Mr. Gorman, the General manager has an impeccable attention to detail and he ensures that every guest is individually taken care of.

Review Title: Such a fun cozy place with the nicest people
Review Text: I would definitely recommend this for anyone traveling to Lagos. It's so beautiful and the service is just incredible. Had so much fun sitting by the pool drinking their awesome signature cocktails ;)

Review Title: Small but classy ambience and quick customer service.
Review Text: Although small, The George Hotel is one hotel that has done a good job in making do with what they have and still meeting luxurious standards/expectations. I had organized a breakfast meeting for my company a few days ago and it went well thanks to their good customer service.

Review Title: the insider tip for business people
Review Text: There are really only two high quality, safe hotels in Ikoyi, and the George is the more refined, personal, selective one. Rooms are contemporary, clean, tasteful. Great free wifi throughout the hotel. A very inviting pool, and a well equipped gym. Bar is popular without being crowded. The restaurant is good, but could do with a somewhat more exciting selection of dishes and a more thoughtful wine list. Staff throughout is professional, enthusiastic, diligent, respectful. Christine at reception and Scholar in the restaurant are class acts. Add to that - you get a free lesson in culture since each floor displays the art of a major artist (such as Caravaggio).

beautiful hotel located in ikoyi. I love the rooms and the great art. Great staffs very friendly and warmly. Beautiful restaurant with great food. The swimming pool OMG.... you will not want to stay a day without swimming. I have found my great home and will surely be back.

This was probably my 6th stay at the George in the last 6 months. The hotel offers true quality, while not being the loud and brash facility that one normally associates with hectic Lagos. The staff always friendly. Great place to hold out of office meetings and conversations.

The George Hotel, Ikoyi is a boutique hotel, with an amazing ambience. The staffs were very pleasant and willing to assist at every point. The meeting room was very comfortable. Overall, we had an amazing experience. i definitely will recommend the hotel.

The George Lagos, i will always recommend any day for excellent services right from the door. You feel very much at home once you step into the hotel with a serene ambience. As regards customer experience, the whole team is exceptional.  My wife and I hosted friends and family for our wedding dinner, all the guests haven't  stopped  talking how they all got pampered.   Great food, cocktails superb and lovely  environment to relax ones mind .  The rooms are so modernly designed and so relaxing and not forgetting the sheets and the bed. No doubt the best, keep up the good work guys.  So magical: Home away from home.  Adetayo Ogunwuyi

Lovely hotel with good rooms, lovely friendly staff and good food! It never feels too buys and has a lovely pool outside. The rooms are spacious enough and the decor is modern. Have stayed in many places in Lagos and The George is by far my favourite! Look forward to visiting again soon!

Just been once for a business meeting, the first impression is great. Very nice staff and service. The lounge area and bar at entrance is great place to relax have short meetings with great drinks and some lovely snacks. The visit is due to have more experience of this place. Good place.

Was invited to say for the weekend at the George and I must say I found it refreshingly different from a lot of Lagos establishments I've visited!  The ambience leaves a lasting impression on you and speaks to the intricate deliberateness you find all over, from the paintings strewn all over to hallways to the scents that leave you breathless, you'll find your self immersed in the enthralling fantasy that The George pulls off.  Rooms were spacious and had quite number of amenities as well as a customized slide show on the TV set.   I like the fact that you get a call back from the team if lines to them are engaged and your request is treated promptly. My dinner order whilst being tasty, was a tad to small in portions for the price tag attached. This should be improved.   Had a

Dear Gordon, thank you. For one more time you have provide with very good afternoon tea. Its so important here to have a confidence in a service, knowing you can bring guests to the restaurant and not to have massive "wahala".

Great place overall. Friendly ambiance.  The place is clean, staff are at your service, and rooms have a working area for a laptop. It is also spacious. I can recommend it to anyone visiting Lagos. Kudos to the hotel.

The George was a very nice hotel in Lagos. Staff was very polite. The front desk we're welcoming. Food could have been better but still good. Some items on the menu were never in stock. If I would return to Lagos I would stay there again.

The George is an exceptional hotel in Lagos, and dare I say, in Nigeria. Delightful and helpful staff, great ambiance, excellent service, comfy beds, wonderful breakfast and if you're ever there on Sunday,  I highly recommend the Brunch with champagne and a live band that just makes you want to stay on. The hotel also has a well-equipped gym and  big pool. All you need is here!

I think The George is an experience anyone that wants a break from anything should have.  It will refresh you... For sure.  I spent two nights there with my better half as a 25th anniversary, and we have both concluded it was a memorable experience.  I do recommend The George.

Pros:  - Despite clear lack of taste (extremly modern hotel with 16c Italian paintings and names like Da Vinci....) it is relatively clean inside.   - Food is not bad, even though the choice is fairly limited.  Cons:  - Unlike any other decent hotel around the world, the General Manager is operating a PRE PAID policy. Relatively small, good (and improving) hotel in good location on Lagos Victoria Island. With good amenities (pool, restaurant, gym). Would recommend to try if you are visiting Lagos for business......

I have stayed twice at the George for business trips.  Most recently during Christmas week.  The hotel has a friendly and welcoming atmosphere.  The rooms are good size and comfortable.  The place is much more personal than you get at the big chains and I personally like that - some may find aspects quirky - depends what you want. The pool area is nice to relax.  Restaurant serves very good food - can be a little slow by UK standards but as it probably takes you 3 hours to get through the traffic who's counting!  Security is good. If you are here on business, I'd thoroughly recommend.  Keep up the good work The George.  Thank you for having me.

The George is really lovely hotel tucked away from the hustle & bustle of Lagos. There are three things I love about this hotel: The service, the homey feel and the Sunday brunch! A worthy mention goes to Raphael who helped out when I hosted a couple of friends for drinks and canap√©s. He went over and beyond what was expected of him, shame I didn't see him again to say thank you but I did mention it to the Hotel Manager. My 2nd stay in as many months and I will definitely return.

What a wonderful place tucked away from the bustle of Lagos. Nice and friendly staff. Great food. The nightly chocolates, in room, was a pleasant surprise. Felt at home and addressed by name at all times. I will definitely return. Keep it up, guys.

Review Title: Friendly staff, but service not up to par.
Review Text: Very clean environment, very friendly staff, but service not excellent. On arrival I was at first checked into the wrong room and when I requested for laundry service no one turned up. In the morning I was woken up by loud maintenance work being done on the connecting door to my room. The front desk apologised though.

My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary here and it was the best place we could have chosen. Warm staff, good food, lovely and elegant deco. What's not to like, close to popular Suya Spot and few minutes drive away from cinemas

If you are LUX traveler - this place exactly for you.  All from the parking to courtyard very clean, classy and with own style. All staff very professional and helpful. Special thanks to the Chef - setup and presentation of Sunday Brunch and all food in the restaurant was really LUX class. Highly Recomended!

A splendid quiet hotel in a calm area of Lagos. Well manicured gardens, excellent dining areas, fully functional business and conference  section. I did not use the gym but those who did meant it was well equipped. The halls and walls display great works of art which creates a good ambience. My room was grand and I loved the lavish bath tub. The hotel baths carried Africology products, which I personally  love so that was a bonus. The devil is in the little details, the helpful IT guy, the numerous staff moving invisibly and constantly cleaning, the lady Patience greeting you with a smile at breakfast remembering I drink a pot of tea with 2 teabags inside, not one. Yes I will return to this hotel.

Excellent service , dedicated staff, very good food, very clean , very quite , very good service , banqueting service exceptional , catered to my every demand ,front desk staff very accommodating to my various needs. Exceptional Hotel will definitely recommend

A luxury and quiet boutique hotel with good levels of service and fine cuisine. Breakfast is excellent although sometimes a little slow for the eggs to be cooked. There is a good but small gym. I would recommend the hotel if you would like a quiet, high quality hotel.

Review Title: Still finding its feet, Poor Value
Review Text: Just checked in yesterday and regretting my choice already.   I got here at 8AM, way before check-in, so I arrived expecting a wait. I didn‚Äôt, however, expect it to be the coldest wait ever. The air-conditioning in the lounge was way too strong and it felt even colder thanks to the rain. I asked the waiter to kindly turn it down a bit but he declined. I was particularly surprised since I was the only one there.  When I asked for my mocha to be served with soy milk (I‚Äôm lactose intolerant) I was told they didn‚Äôt have any. When I cancelled the order, the waiter insisted that regular milk would be fine and even asked me ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs so special about soy milk?‚Äù   Getting some peace and quiet today for sleep has also been difficult. As I type this, there is really loud music blaring

My first time at The George was on a date with a suitor. Their buffet spread was awesome! I am such a foodie and finnicky with my foods. I can't wait to eat there again. The ambience was good too.  I definitely recommend The George.

I had a work meeting at the George and I have to say the environment made it very bearable (as it was a public holiday and I wasn't meant to be working) I don't know if this means I need to work on my social life or if the place is new but I had never heard of the place before and I felt like I discovered some hidden gem. Lol long story short is I loved it and they know how to cook snails.

I stayed here with my husband and i must commend the Nice Toiletries and handy concierge.  pleasant staff and nice parking. However breakfast comes with an additional charge. Regardless I would return soon

Review Title: Quality bedrooms, quiet surroundings, excellent pool area and great food
Review Text: Rooms and bathrooms very well equipped, large and clean. Breakfast and dinner excellent. Pool area ideal for sundowner or snack. Friendly and efficient staff. Located in Ikoyi so close to facilities but still in a quiet area.

The George has gotten many things right: the toiletries, the rooms, and the front desk service. I was pleasantly surprised by many of these little touches. The breakfast spread is good, with a combination of continental and local food. The croissants are bit dry but that is the only complaint about breakfast. The only thing I didn't really like was that I had put up an in-room-dining breakfast card one day and I woke up to find my card still hanging outside the door. When I called to enquire, they asked if I knew that I would be charged for the breakfast to which I replied yes and my breakfast was delivered half an hour later. Now, I wasn't in a rush so it was fine but I would have been extremely annoyed if I had been.

We were in Da Vinci restaurant at George. we also had an evening at the poolside bar. Food was nice, but slightly expensive, but this is lagos! rib eye was a good treat. one of my colleagues had jumbo prawns and they were truly jumbo. finger food at the bar was nice too, mutton kebab, samoosas recommended. good service and very clean and presentable environment.

Unquestionably amazing hotel. From customer service, appearance, attention to details, this hotel had it all.   Restaurant was great, food selection et. al.  I would be remiss if I do not commend ALL the staff. They were very pleasant and welcoming; the front staff, restaurant, concierge.   My husband, little daughter and I enjoyed every aspect of our stay. No complaints whatsoever. We were sad to leave but when in town again, we would definitely stay there again.   Without a doubt, I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Review Title: One of the best in Lagos
Review Text: We stayed at this hotel for a week-end with business either side. It is well located in its own compound in Ikoyi for business meetings all over Lagos and is quiet and private. The rooms are modern and have good amenities including the hotel wifi. We used many of the facilities including the restaurant for breakfast and dinner which were of a high standard and the bar and the pool area, all of which enhanced our stay. We raised a problem with the client relations manager and it was dealt with immediately and to our full satisfaction.

Great location and facilities and most important personalized and attentive service. Gym is very modern, rooms are spacious and clean. The restaurant has a nice selection of international and local cuisine.

Enjoyed my time at The George Lagos. It was central located for easy access to my meeting points. I will definitely  be back. Great team and speed of service by the room service, lovely experience. Thank you all.

Great staff, clean rooms, new and modern finishing with great sense of colors. I enjoyed the view from the highest floor over looking the pool. The reception staff are so great, very helpful and always having this welcome smiles. I will surely be back there.

A breathtaking experience that will do better with a little attention  to details. The facility is fantastically located and the serene nature makes a home out of it. The interior is contemporary in its furnishing. The state of the art fitness centre keeps you longing for the gym.

Review Title: Best Hotel in Lagos, solid 5 stars
Review Text: The service is impeccable, the rooms are very comfortable and quiet, the location is central, the restaurant selection is extensive and very well made, and in total the entire experience was amazing. The key to this hotels success in my opinion is in the services, and the staff were all Ace.

Great hotel in a good, safe location, wonderful attentive staff and the hotel provides a quality night sleep in a busy Lagos! Good gym and the rooms are ample size with everything you need. Best hotel in Lagos.. Definitely a recommendation!

Review Title: Hands down the best hotel in Lagos, Nigeria
Review Text: Lagos has a lot of overrated hotels but the George is the best I have ever stayed in so far. In Nigerian standard; a quality 5 stars hotel in the heart of old Ikoyi. The food is all sort of incredible, try the jumbo shrimps. The staff are so friendly

Review Title: Weekend stay at The George hotel, Lagos
Review Text: My husband and I stayed the weekend at this lovely hotel.  The service was excellent, the room was clean, modern and very comfortable.  One of the most comfortable hotel beds  I have ever been in.  We found the staff to be flexible, clearly wanting to please us as customers.  This hotel rates favourably alongside many similarly rated hotels I have stayed in around the world - an oasis within a bustling metropolis.  I would certainly go back and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

The service was fantastic with great rooms and wonderful location. The staff were all well behaved and very courteous.  The meals were very tasty and buffet arrangement was very comfortable.  The pool area is really nice.

Review Title: Nice hotel but not as great as the hype
Review Text: I stayed at this hotel over the bank holiday weekend and I have to admit, the ambience was very great and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The food however was sub par and for the price we had to pay I was extremely disappointed.  1st they had a buffet service only which isn't really fine dining.  Then the quality of the buffet food was abysmal: if I had to rate that I'd make it 3 out of 10. If I take the dining experience out of the mix, this is easily the best hotel in Lagos!

I have traveled the world and The George is truly has the most luxuries rooms. Every now and then you find a gem....Just loved it Staff professional, polite and very helpful. It is well placed and very safe area

Review Text: The service is impeccable, the rooms are very comfortable and quiet, the location is central, the restaurant selection is extensive and very well made, and in total the entire experience was amazing. The key to this hotels success in my opinion is in the services, and the staff were all Ace.

Great hotel in a good, safe location, wonderful attentive staff and the hotel provides a quality night sleep in a busy Lagos! Good gym and the rooms are ample size with everything you need. Best hotel in Lagos.. Definitely a recommendation!

Review Title: Hands down the best hotel in Lagos, Nigeria
Review Text: Lagos has a lot of overrated hotels but the George is the best I have ever stayed in so far. In Nigerian standard; a quality 5 stars hotel in the heart of old Ikoyi. The food is all sort of incredible, try the jumbo shrimps. The staff are so friendly

Review Text: My husband and I stayed the weekend at this lovely hotel.  The service was excellent, the room was clean, modern and very comfortable. This hotel rates favourably alongside many similarly rated hotels I have stayed in around the world - an oasis within a bustling metropolis.  I would certainly go back and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Review Title: By George - what a gem you are!
Review Text: For those who find themselves on the road whether for business or pleasure, the choice for accomodation can make a big difference to one‚Äôs perception of whether the trip was a wonderful and great trip or not. Having stayed at the intermittently disorganized Intercontinental Lagos a few times before moving to the wonderful Wheatbaker I was looking forward to this latest business trip.  My Lagos office threw me a curve ball and booked me to stay this time at The George. I didn‚Äôt check out the George on Tripadvisor and secretly hoped that the George is closer to the Wheatbaker experience I had previously. A oasis in the bustling, crowded mega-city of Lagos, Nigeria. The George is well staffed, well run, clean, cool and quiet, and lies within its own walls and security staff. Guest services are fully up to what one expects in a western hotel, fast service, good business center, attentive staff. The restaurant is simply excellent, with a mix of western standards and some excellent Nigerian dishes on buffet nightly. Room service is fast and efficient. Detractors? The wifi internet is somewhat spotty, and needs reinitializing almost hourly, but is strong, fast and capable otherwise (netflix streaming works well, for example). The pool is beautiful, but seems to have the slightest suspicious algae green cast. All in all,  I would be sure to stay again at The George when next in Lagos.

Good food, excellent customer service, a benchmark for other hotels to follow.  Love the environment.they really paid attention to detail in making sure that guests get that wow treatment that will lure them to come back again.  Downside:Not much really but the hotel is pricey but hey who cares as far as you get good value for your money.

You have to visit this hotel in Nigeria. I have traveled the world and I must say I will come back.  Anthony Robin is a top chef with extradionary dishes with succulent taste. I felt like fire works in my mouth. The staff is very attentive and professional.

wonderful services and a great place to unwind and still do business from. from the environment outside to the rooms everything looked really great. i will recommend this hotel to anyone who values great services.

By far one of my favorite hang out spots in Lagos. Coming here for Sunday brunch has become a weekly ritual that my family, friends and I look forward to. The service is second to none and their buffet offers a wide variety to choose from. Chef Anthony Robin never disappoints.

Excellent hotel of its class, hotel was very clean as well as the rooms were beautifully finished with an exceptional homely feeling. Front desk staff and staff in general were extremely nice and welcoming. Breakfast and dinner was the best that I had in Lagos that I have ever experienced, ranging from boiled yam and egg sauce to waffles to smoothies to fresh fruits(kiwi, plums, apples etc) and even granola! I can honestly say that I got The George Experience

Great service, tasty food, cool atmosphere, the most interesting aspect is the staff remembering my name having visited just once before. I must confess being a traveller this hotel has got Good service consistency and the Staff are always wearing smiles like they've got no challenges.

I can't commend this hotel enough.  Think chic boutique hotels along the lines of the G&V or Malmaison.  My room over looked the pool and was spacious, modern and clean.  Staff are attentive, friendly and welcoming from the moment you enter past the secure gates.  It really is an oasis of calm within the vibrant hustle and bustle of Ikoyi and Victoria Island.  Quality and presentation of food is at an excellent level.  The management team should be very proud of what they've accomplished in such a short time.

Located In the heart of ikoyi with different classes of rooms in a serene environment. I have been to many hotels in Lagos but this is the most preferred.   from the security gate, down to reception to food and beverage,everything was just in place for my relaxation.  The rooms were completely stocked with all the facilities needed. Good for business trips and family outing as well.

We all look at this as a new small hotel. Oh but your very much mistaken. the grand yet small hotel is got class to another level. we were greeted by the staff both at the entrance and at the reception. the hotel given you a very warm feeling, more like home away from home.  I went along with 3 other friends for an early dinner. The selection of food was fantastic although the menu was not so necessary. The manager and head chef came along to welcome us. Review Title: The Most Homely Hotel in Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed a few hotels in Lagos and this is by far the most homely. The rooms are lovely, the internet fast and the staff professional. The George is a world class boutique hotel with personal attention to details.

Awesome experience It was when I visited this master piece, food selection was great and really sumptuous service was quick and very detailed.  wine selection can be compared to any hotel restaurant I have visited in the world and the sommelier is highly knowledgeable.

Exceeded my expectations for the hotel. The rooms are simply amazing- the sheets and the pillows are divine. Very impressed with the ambiance and the location of the hotel. If you are looking for a home away from home, this is the place for you. staff. .

I've booked 2 group dinners at The George. Very enjoyable evening at the private room. Dayo, the Food & Bev. Manager has excellent customer relations! Excellent service from the entire crew in the restaurant. Great ambience and attention to detail in the hotel.  Dayo makes it easy to keep going back to the restaurant. Kudos.

I have read reviews about the slow service at the poolside, and my hubby and I experienced this when we went for   snacks and drinks by the pool on a Saturday evening. After several attempts to get a waiter's attention, we were finally attended to. They were polite and apologetic all right, but it was the same thing when trying to catch someone's attention to bring our bill and order a coffee.   I should have taken a cue from the waiter's momentary hesitation when I asked if they had decaf cappuccino. After taking one sip, I could tell it was instant coffee with a milky froth on top. When asked, the waiter did not deny it, he said it was decaf instant , but that he had put it through the espresso machine! Four bucks for instant coffee with a froth!  The food we ordered was tasty

Chef Anthony and his team are simply awesome. The creativity and simplicity the chef brings to his dishes is magical to say the least. I salute this great chef and indeed this great hotel I recommend the food and the attention to detail in this great hotel. Proud of Nigeria

Its a great place to be, great food, state of the heart facilities and well trained staffs, was in one of the suites and I felt at home, definitely my choice in town and the first of its kind, the staffs are helpful.

It was an experience worth it, was given 3 options of places to hangout I choose The george as it's one of the option and I didn't regret it. The service was great the food was good, the cocktail was excellent. I really love it there.

Review Title: An unexpected gem in the heart of lagos

Review Title: Great Hotel. But Food was a little on the expensive side.
Review Text: Great hotel. Very  clean and rooms are very spacious. Wished the pool had more sun than it did. Seems the pool location did not give full sun for majority of the afternoon. Food was very good. and the staff was good especially Doris in the breakfast area.

The service at The George exceeded my exception. They have exceptional staff and management alike. We had an issue upon arrival and it was quickly handled by the Operations Manager. The decor in the hotel gives the illusion of being outside the country. i was very impressed. The buffet selection for the day was diverse enough for me to have a taste of both the local cuisine and continental cuisine.   I will definitely recommend it to my friends and family.

The service received and the facilities were splendid. There is no doubt that the management of the hotel has positioned.  In any case, why restrict the opinion to a minimum of two hundred characters when some persons are just too busy and may decline responding as a result

Hotel restaurant buffet and food not quite as good as the Wheatbaker nearby, but poolside bar service was lovely after a long day out in the city.  Recommend it highly.

The room was very spacious , bathroom was extremely clean with a bathtub and shower available. This was my first time The George and I will definitely be back. The staff was also very pleasant and always happy to help.

I went for lunch at the Davinci restraurant and it was an absolute delight. The ambient was a blend of African and continental settings as well as food mix was bliss. Pricing wasn't as expensive as I imagined.

Review Text: Holding our strategy session at The George was a decision worth every reason. The mix of business and serenity with great ambience made the stay worthwhile. The rooms are welcoming and well finished......been a while I saw rooms with quality finishing around. ..and the arts that adorned the walls, they were great!

Review Text: Nice clean rooms. Luxurious, serene and relaxing environment. I almost forgot that I was right in the heart of Ikoyi, Lagos, just off a really busy road. The rooms were clean, staff were friendly and professional in their approach. The food was okay though some of the small chops needed a bit more seasoning to give flavour. overall a really nice experience. I hope the management keep up the standard.

A great restaurant, with wonderful and delightful menu in a hi class environment. Easy access, easy parking. Good to have aperitif around the pool. Service and personnel high class. Rooms very comfortable. Also available a large and well equipped gym.  I just highly recommend  for business or family stay, lunch or dinner.

Our stay at The George was exceptional. Terrific service, stunning new facility, beautiful rooms (great toiletries) and a fabulous breakfast service with at-the-table French Press coffee.  Really fast wi-fi.  Pub dinner was pricey but at a hotel of this caliber it is to be expected, and it was prompt and delicious.

The George is by far better than the Wheatbaker... the rooms are great, the service is good, gym and pool are top. definitely the new place to be in Lagos! The George is setting very high standards and will attract all the key people in Lagos.  Stephane

Decor is beautiful and of top quality The rooms are beautifully decorated and cozy The location is good and easily accessible staff are  friendly and respectful I loved the decor overall, The George  is first class

Excellent facilities, friendly and reliable staff, very good food, reasonable pricing. The new kid on the block which will compete with the Wheatbaker and win a large proportion of the upmarket, discerning clientele that frequents Lagos for business.

We had our work retreat at The George Ikoyi, Lagos. The ambience was excellent and food was ethnic and delicious. I will recommend The George Lagos for anyone in Lagos and doing business or on vacation in the Island.

Lovely boutique hotel with excellent service. Good for meetings and conferences though number of rooms are limited. Otherwise it is a very nice hotel, I would love to stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Excellent hotel , just very expensive, room was equipped with everything needed for a long stay ,hotel is the heart of the Island so within reach of most businesses in Lagos Island ,breakfast was good but could be better .Overall I had a good experience , quality service ,and would recommend Hotel to any business traveller

the hotel fantastic,quality service under the manager Guy! I enjoyed the gym, the food was tasty and fresh well laid out. The reception when we arrived was speedy and warm welcome by all. We enjoyed the complimentary eve hosted and sponsored by Diamond bank executive Director: Victor Ezenwoko.

This hotel has a great location.  The airport transfer was on time and the gentleman was very friendly and helpful. The food was good. The spacious bedrooms and comfortable beds make for a good nights rest.  The wifi is reliable. All in all this is great base for any business traveler, they have great meeting room facilities and a first class gym as well as all other facilities you could expect from a 5star establishment.
